title: Reissuance of and Amendments to National Security Presidential Memorandum 5 on Strengthening the Policy of the United States Toward Cuba
summary: The document is a presidential memorandum issued on June 30, 2025, which rescinds and amends National Security Presidential Memorandum 5 regarding U.S. policy toward Cuba. The memorandum outlines a policy aimed at promoting freedom, democracy, human rights, and free enterprise in Cuba. Key actions include restricting financial transactions with entities controlled by the Cuban military or security services, enforcing the ban on tourism, and supporting the Cuban people through expanded internet services, free press, and lawful travel. The memorandum also directs various federal agencies to implement these policies within specified timelines and to report on their progress. It supersedes previous presidential directives on Cuba and emphasizes the U.S. commitment to advancing the interests of both the United States and the Cuban people.
